system.description:
Chief. A guardian deity that protects the Dharma. Worshipped and channeled when having to fend off injustices and horrors. They are commonly other demons or ashras that have been tamed by monks and buddhas. The first Dharmapala is the monk Sri Kera Jadara, the First Militant Shaman-Monk who traveled the Sword Isles to bind a thousand thousand demons to servitude to the buddha. This is the greatest treasure: eight of them were Demon-Kings, the most powerful of Dharmapala. After his death, the monk rejected Parinirvana and chose to become the vajra, bell, sword, and trident that many dharmapala are allowed to wield.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter with 4 Kadungganan. Check the book for higher ranks.)

traits.name: Poise
traits.description: Whenever a Chief suffers a Status Effect or is forcibly moved, they can choose to ignore it and gain a Poise Token instead. When they gain 5 Poise Tokens, they become Poise Broken: they can suffer all Status Effects, can be forcibly moved as normal, and cannot gain any more Poise Tokens. While Poise Broken, a Chief loses 1 Poise Token whenever they start their riff. When they lose all Poise Tokens, they lose Poise Broken and can again gain Poise Tokens.

traits.name: Dragon Eye
traits.description: Chiefs can riff a number of times per Resound equal to the Kadungganan.

traits.name: Turn The Wheel
traits.description: At the beginning of every Resound, all Ba-enense fighters gain 1 Merit, which they can gain up to 3 of. All Ba-enense add their current Merit as attack dice.

traits.name: Budding Karma
traits.description: Whenever the Dharmapala is the target of an attack, the attacker suffers Karma until they're attacked.

traits.name: Padma
traits.description: Attacks against any fighters with Karma are Skewering and Overwhelming

traits.name: The Wheel
traits.description: The Dharmapala can move through enemies. If they do, they push 1 the enemy out of the way and then inflict 1 Hit, once per enemy.

system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Burning Palm. Attack an enemy in range 10 with Faith, setting aflame, then teleport 1 the target.

Gambits [[/r d10]]

Phase 1: Budding Guardian. Small and unbroken, humanoid form.

1-6: Inflict Violence > Inflict Violence > Lotus Consequence [1]: Inflict Karma on 1 enemy in range 4.

7-12: Rush > Samsara [2]: Inflict 1 True Hit on all enemies with Karma, then heal 2.

Phase 2: Diamond Is Unbreakable: Blossom, like a lotus, into a great dharmapala. The dharmapala becomes Size 2.

1-3: Inflict Violence > Inflict Violence > Lotus Consequence [1]: Inflict Karma on 1 enemy in range 4.

4-6: Rush > Vast Consequence Lotus [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (burst 5) with Bravery. If the target has Karma, gain +Faith.

7-9: Rush > Samsara [1]: Inflict 1 True Hit on all enemies with Karma, then heal 2. > Inflict Violence, inflicting Karma on the target.

10: Closer To Buddha [3]: Meditate. The Dharmapala cannot perform anything else but Meditation. They Heal 1 every start of riff. At the end of Resound 7, they unravel into a blossoming lotus, and then teleport to heaven, and send a burning palm down, immediately fulfilling any Defeat Condition and ending Violence.
